title: Benefits of delayed cord clamping in healthy babies

title_detail.value: Benefits of delayed cord clamping in healthy babies

summary: A five-minute delay in the clamping of healthy infants' umbilical cords results in increased iron stores and brain myelin in areas important for early-life functional development, a new study has found.

summary_detail.value: A five-minute delay in the clamping of healthy infants' umbilical cords results in increased iron stores and brain myelin in areas important for early-life functional development, a new study has found.
